      • generateRandomAESKey

        public javax.crypto.SecretKey generateRandomAESKey(int keyLength)
                                            throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Generates an returns an AES-Key with the specified length. If the length is neither 128 nor 256 Bit, it will be set to 256 Bit.
        Parameters:
        keyLength - the desired keylength, must be 128 or 256
        Returns:
        the generated AES-Key
        Throws:
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException

      • generateRandomAESKeyFromPasswordGetSalt

                                                                         int keyLength)
                                                                  throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Generates an AES-Key from the given password with the given keylength. If the keylength is neither 128 nor 256 Bit, it will be set to 256 Bit.
        Parameters:

        keyLength - the desired keylength
        Returns:
        the AES-Key and the salt
        Throws:
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException

                                     javax.crypto.SecretKey secretKey)
                              throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Encrypts a given plaintext with the given AES secret key. Also generates a random iv used for encrypting.
        Parameters:
        plainText - the text to be encrypted
        secretKey - the AES key to be used for encryption
        Returns:
        an instance of the class CipherMacIV holding the cipher, iv and mac
        Throws:
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException

                         byte[] iv,
                         javax.crypto.SecretKey secretKey)
                  throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Decrypts a ciphertext that was encrypted with an AES-Key and an initialization vector
        Parameters:
        cipherText - the ciphertext to be decrypted
        iv - the initialization vector used for encryption
        secretKey - the secret key used for encryption
        Returns:
        the plaintext as byte array
        Throws:
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException

                                         java.lang.String filename)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the ciphertext and the initialization vector contained in CipherIV object in two seperate files, encoded in Base64. The files are only accessible by your app.
        Parameters:
        data - the CipherIV instance
        filename - the filename
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • saveCipherAndIVToSharedPrefBase64

        public void saveCipherAndIVToSharedPrefBase64(AESCrypto.CipherIV data,
                                              java.lang.String spAlias,
                                              java.lang.String cipherIvAlias)
        Saves the ciphertext and the initialization vector contained in CipherIV object in two seperate SharedPref aliases, encoded in Base64. The SharedPrefs are only accessible by your app.
        Parameters:
        data - the CipherIV object
        spAlias - the alias for the SharedPref
        cipherIvAlias - the alias for the ciphertext and iv

                                            java.lang.String cipherIvAlias)

        Parameters:
        spAlias - The alias for the Shared Pref.
        cipherIvAlias - The alias for the cipherIv object.

      • storeAESKeyInSharedPrefBase64

        public void storeAESKeyInSharedPrefBase64(java.lang.String spAlias,
                                          java.lang.String keyAlias,
                                          javax.crypto.SecretKey secretKey)
        Stores the given secret key into the apps shared preferences, encoded to Base64. The SharedPreferences are only accessible by your app.
        Parameters:
        spAlias - the alias of the SharedPref
        keyAlias - the alias under which the key is to be stored in the SharedPrefs
        secretKey - the secret key to be stored
